source:
# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (sap hr) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge)
- **New Data:** where a Pers_No in the source does not exist as an EmployeeNumber in the target. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on Pers_No in source and EmployeeNumber in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an EmployeeNumber in the target exists but the same Pers_No doesn't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_new is created

%%sql  

-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_new 

    AS

-- gets data that matches of CaseReference and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT
    CASE
        WHEN T1.CaseReference IS NULL
        THEN T5.CasemarkingBridgeID
        ELSE NULL
    END as CasemarkingBridgeID, -- surrogate 
    T1.CasemarkingFactID AS CasemarkingID,
    T6.CaseID AS CaseFactID,
    T1.CaseReference,
    T2.SourceSystemID as SourceSystemID,
    CURRENT_TIMESTAMP AS IngestionDate,
    NULL AS ValidTo,
    md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.CaseReference,'.'),IFNULL(T1.CasemarkingFactID,'.'))) AS RowID,
    'Y' AS IsActive,
    CASE
        WHEN T1.CaseReference = T5.CaseReference AND md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.CaseReference,'.'),IFNULL(T1.CasemarkingFactID,'.'))) <> T5.RowID-- same employee, changed data
        THEN 'Y'
        WHEN T5.CaseReference IS NULL -- new comment
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END as NewData,
    CASE
        WHEN T1.CaseReference IS NULL
        THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
    END AS  DeletedData, 
    T1.IsActive as HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_casemarking_fact T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "SAP HR" = T2.Description AND T2.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge T5 ON T1.CaseReference = T5.CaseReference AND T5.IsActive = 'Y'
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_fact T6 ON T1.CaseReference = T6.CaseReference AND T6.IsActive = 'Y'


WHERE
     -- flags new data        
    (CASE
        WHEN T1.CaseReference = T5.CaseReference AND md5(concat(IFNULL(T1.CaseReference,'.'),IFNULL(T1.CasemarkingFactID,'.'))) <> T5.RowID    -- same employee, changed data
            THEN 'Y'
            WHEN T5.CaseReference IS NULL -- new employee
            THEN 'Y'
            ELSE 'N'
        END  = 'Y' )

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_changed_rows is created

%%sql

-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 

Select 
    CasemarkingBridgeID, -- surrogate 
    CasemarkingID,
    CaseFactID,
    CaseReference,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
From checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'

SELECT
    CasemarkingBridgeID, -- surrogate 
    CasemarkingID,
    CaseFactID,
    CaseReference,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge
WHERE CaseReference IN (SELECT CaseReference FROM checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_new WHERE CasemarkingBridgeID IS NULL) AND IsActive = 'Y';

# View checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the Business Key (i.e. Pers_No from SAP HR), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the business key, insert rows
## Table checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge.employee_dim is updated

%%sql
-- merge into fact table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge AS Target
USING checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge_changed_rows AS Source

ON Source.CaseReference = Target.CaseReference

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = date_sub(current_timestamp,1),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows
WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT * ;

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised.checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new CasemarkingBridgeID

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY CasemarkingBridgeID NULLS LAST) AS CasemarkingBridgeID, -- surrogate key
    CasemarkingID,
    CaseFactID,
    CaseReference,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.checkmark_case_casemarking_bridge;
